meanings.definition: The quality of being enduring or lasting.
meanings.sent1: Her enduringnesses in the face of adversity inspired everyone around her.
meanings.sent2: The enduringnesses of the ancient ruins amazed the archaeologists.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner's enduringnesses in eating ice cream after every race was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The enduringnesses of the old oak tree stood as a symbol of strength in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The enduringnesses of the bond between the two friends was truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: The state of being able to withstand wear, pressure, or damage.
meanings.sent1: The enduringnesses of the steel beams ensured the building's stability.
meanings.sent2: The enduringnesses of the hiking boots made them perfect for rough terrain.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's enduringnesses to laser beams made for a funny scene in the movie.
meanings.sent4: The enduringnesses of the shield protected the knight in battle.
meanings.sent5: The enduringnesses of the phone case saved the device from many falls.

meanings.definition: The ability to continue over a long period of time.
meanings.sent1: The enduringnesses of the battery allowed the flashlight to last for days.
meanings.sent2: The enduringnesses of the tradition kept it alive for generations.
meanings.sent3: The cat's enduringnesses in chasing its tail provided endless entertainment.
meanings.sent4: The enduringnesses of the melody lingered in the air long after the music stopped.
meanings.sent5: The enduringnesses of the story captivated listeners for hours on end.
